title: How to advertise my resume writing service - Quora

response.answer_text: Step one - who is your target audience?  If you think it will be graduating seniors, then advertising on sites frequented by college seniors is the place to start. Step two - identify (and thus advertise) the value that your service brings.  Have people been successful in using your service?  (do you keep stats?  If not, perhaps start);  are you willing to start from scratch (for one price) but able to tweak an existing resume for fewer dollars; how will your resume fare if companies are using software to screen?  etc. Step three.  Can you get former clients to comment favorably on your service?   Step four - can you get a speaking engagement (free) at a university or college (through student services perhaps) on how to prepare a resume?  Many students will pay for you to do it rather than do the work themselves if you can present helpful information.  (not all advertising has to be on-line). Step five - create a great web site, complete with helpful hints and articles so that people can find information - plus your service -whether they are job hunting or college seniors. Step six - do a weekly blog on items of general interest to job hunters - not just resume writing but also things such as interviewing skills, job seeking strategies etc.

Create a tips page on job search strategies and advertise your service there.  Give some good tips to show your knowledge of career development. People will acknowledge your expertise and trust you are competent.

Focus on your target audience and build relationships with possible customers. Don't forget to launch blog and write great content.  I also wrote article about startup marketing - The Ultimate Startup Marketing Checklist
